intro: Tubella nana, commonly known as the dwarf tubella, is a small, perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Tubella nana grows close to the ground, often forming dense mats in rocky or sandy soils. It is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in tundra and alpine environments.
